sentences: Marios Tofi (Greek: Μάριος Τοφή, pronounced [ˈmários ˈtofí]; born 24 February 1990 in Athens, Greece) is a Greek Cypriot singer and songwriter.
He is best known for representing Cyprus at the Junior Eurovision Song Contest 2004 with the song "Onira".
Marios Tofi was born on 24 February 1990 in Athens, Greece to Cypriot parents.

sentences: === 2005 - Tours / Festivals / Awards / Collaboration with Chiara ===
section: == Biography == | === 2005 - Tours / Festivals / Awards / Collaboration with Chiara ===

sentences: In June 2005, Marios participated in the International Song Festival "Song – Magic" in Varna, Bulgaria and won the "Special Award by the Jury" as the best of all among 15 countries and more than 100 songs with the songs "Xehnas" ("You forget") (Music/Lyrics: Andreas Gerolemou) and "Unbreakable" (Music: Michael Roussos, Lyrics: John Vickers).
section: == Biography == | === 2005 - Tours / Festivals / Awards / Collaboration with Chiara ===

sentences: In August 2005, Marios participated in the International Song Festival "Palangos Gaida – 2005" in Palanga, Lithuania and won the "Audience Award" with the song "M' ena fili" ("With a kiss") (Music: Andrius Kulikausko, Lyrics: Andreas Gerlemou).

sentences: In December 2005, Marios collaborated with Chiara from Malta (2nd place – Eurovision Song Contest 2005) and made a duet with title "Once upon a dream" (Music: Michael Roussos, Greek lyrics: George Ioannou, English lyrics: John Vickers).
